review: Good series thats plagued by very anti customer practices.  I would suggest that no one purchase any future games by 2k and gearbox. practices like this need to be punished with no sales.

game_description: The Ultimate Vault Hunter’s Upgrade lets you get the most out of the Borderlands 2 experience.
review:
Bitterly disappointed with the Borderlands 3 exclusivity announcement on the Epic store. Either Gearbox/2K has completely misunderstood its customer base, or the money Epic paid was worth it.

However, BL2 is a fantastic game. Shame about its publishers recent decisions.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
I want to love it, but if you are playing co-op it is a mess. Desync, lag, fps stutters, glitches, etc. I have played the original BL1 co-op on pc several times through and I don't remember many issues, but this version is full of them.

Again, I want to love it. The improvements they have made are mostly small, but add up and manage to keep the game feeling a bit more fresh. But it's hard to appreciate new guns, great textures/lighting, and a minimap and an improved UI when your game drops to 30fps every time you turn around/sprint, there is a distinct bullet damage delay (even as host), and your friends are moving like they are in a slow flicker strobe light.

A solid patch could fix all of this and flip my remove in a heart-beat, but I am worried it won't come and that the original BL1 (with all of it's outdated clunk) will be better than this remaster.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
I really tried to like this game, I even played coop with friends to increase my experience, but this game is just a series of fetch quests.

The first few hours of any entertainment experience need a hook, this one did well for the first hour, but shortly after the intro it became evident that it's nothing more than a series of go to X and retrieve Y over and over again. I gave up after 3 hours of repetitive fetch-questing. Maybe it gets better but I wasn't willing to invest more time into fetch-grinding to find out.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Oh where to begin!? This game is so great! I have have so many good things to share about it! It has some really nice graphics compared to the old one. Aaaaaaand that's where the good stops. 

Look I love starting my game up every time to find my settings reset just as much as I love a good gaper but there's a limit. Also don't get me started on how bad the loot drop rates were skewered I mean seriously? Two legendarys in a playthrough? Cm'om gearbox! 

Then they somehow managed to break an already decent Co-op. I could not play for 5 minutes in my friends game without lagging all over the place like I was inside an infected colon. Even when everything was going alright I would get disconnected from the game like i was antman getting snapped out of Thanos's bunghole.

Finally, and this is the cardinal sin! Randy PringleDork promised that the final boss fight would be changed. I would have been okay with all of the other problems if this was true! But Randy Pitchfork told a half truth here boys,girls and necromorphs,[spoiler]The Final boss sh*ts out a f*ucking chest[/spoiler]

No changes otherwise! 
In summary, this version sucks, at this point there are no patches to fix it and i doubt it will come anytime soon.
1 dumpaloo /10

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Get ready for the mind blowing insanity! Play as one of four trigger-happy mercenaries and take out everything that stands in your way! With its addictive action, frantic first-person shooter combat, massive arsenal of weaponry, RPG elements and four-player co-op, Borderlands is a breakthrough experience that challenges all the...
review:
For a 2009 game it looks pretty good, I'll give you that. Now the not-so-great:

Uninteresting gunplay. Yes, really. It's a shooter, but the guns feels meh and the enemies are veritable bullet sponges made of kevlar. 

Clearly aimed at late naughts teenagers with its edgy and randumb humor, but we're so far from 2009 that the schlock becomes almost charming. The story is dumb, but the good kind of dumb. I dig it. 

Khans. The Great Khans, specifically. They're the primary antagonist of the game and they're everywhere. Oh wait, here they're simply called "bandits" and have less personality than a bowl of cheesy potatoes. 

Effective loot system. It's no Diablo II, but it werks and it's the main engine that moves the game foward.  

Padding, padding, so much padding. If you go out of your way to hunt high level mobs, you won't be rewarded. So buckle up, git yourself a bucket of your gamer fuel of choice and follow the trail of breadcrumbs carefully placed by the devs.

Instead of adding depth to the game, the RPG mechanics both hold the gunplay back and force a certain pacing and way to play the game that might not be to everybody's liking. Y'know, the opposite of what RPG systems are supposed to accomplish.  

Can't recommend. Hard pass.

EDIT: added reddit spacing because otherwise it looks like a jumbled mess

review: Played through the original borderlands years ago and have been running through GOTY Enhanced with some friends this week.  As it stands right now, co-op has a lot of issues.  There's a tremendous amount of lag going on.  The host doesn't seem to be impacted as much, but mobs are teleporting all over which makes it hard to aim.  There are also frequent game crashes, and a lot of the game options are reset back to default when you start the game as well, which means we can't disable voice without messing around with the config.  We've decided to wait until everything is patched before continuing the playthrough.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
I really didn't like this game at all. Almost all the npcs were downright annoying and boring. The only playable character that even looked interesting to me was Claptrap and one of his special abilities(Rubber Duck) is one of the most irritating things I have seen in gaming. The side missions are extremely tedious with lots of back and forth with no excitement in playing any of them again IF i decide to play true vault hunter mode and ultimate. I'm gobsmacked at how they can come from a masterpiece like borderlands 2 and end up with this pale comparison. I have not bothered trying the DLC yet... if its anything like the campaign then ill be passing on it.

EDIT: after playing the only released DLC i can honestly say this is in my top 5 for worst games ever played. The DLC was absolutely horrible in every way shape or form. I will never buy another gearbox game again

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
I will admit, this game can be enjoyable to play (Borderlands 2 is more enjoyable anyways).

But, Gearbox has shown that they do not care about us. Their exclusivity deal with Epic Games and certain employees victim blaming responses to fans negativity have shown they are not a dev team that deserves money and respect. They would rather push our worries aside while making fun of us to their loyal fans. There is no way Gearbox had no say in this exclusivity deal. Even if they didn't, they seem to be very happy with it. If you can resist the urge to buy this game, please do so.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Currently i would say if you plan on playing this with friends,DON'T. There are quite a few bugs that make this unplayable.
-Unable to actually mute your in game voice so you have to do it manually everytime you join a game.
-Unable to play with more than 60fps (me and my 2 friends that i was trying to play with were unable to use our 144hz monitors).
-Worst of all the lag that makes it so unplayable at times that only the host can do anything (all 3 of us have good enough internet to stream so we shouldn't be having any issues).
With these issues the quality of life in co-op is just absolute garbage and until they fix it i'd say stick with Borderlands 2.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
Look the game itself is alright. I sunk 11 hours into this last night and prior to that got bored after an hour but i wasn't in the mood to play it back then.

Wouldn't have played 11 hours straight almost if it was trash. HOWEVER. MY FUCKING SAVE GOT DELETED!!!!!

I cannot override my old save, i cannot delete my old save, i cannot make a new save. The games fucked and this bug should NEVER have made it to launch.

EDIT: After some trial and error, turns out my antivirus, Bitdefender, had blocked borderlands from saving to the folder as it was classed as a 'protected' folder. Upon allowing the game was successfully saved. However, my save was not restored by the game, it *mysteriously came back*. This does still happen to people (i assume) without bitdefender. So, while i am enjoying the game, there is a risk that your save may just decide to fuck off one day.

6/10


*Thanks github

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
pro:
* doesnt revolve around slag
* laser weapons are fun
* moon movement with O2 jet is fun

con:
* quests doesnt flow into each other very well
* side quests are boring
* writing/dialog ranges from annoying to borderline annoying
* characters are fucking terrible, especially fuck that anakin kid
* very few enemy types. been fighting the same AI over and over again. borderlands 2 was fun because it is chaotic, you are getting bombarded from multiple angles by AIs that all want to do different stuff
* atmosphere is unmemorable but yet so giant, making huge areas of nothing
* a lot more bugs (jack getting stuck on a quest npc's body so he cannot get on elevator and a few quest givers wont talk to you unless you quit to main menu)

tldr: play borderlands 2 instead

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review: Got this free because I owned the original game. Most bugs have been unpatched. Remaster is barely noticeable, and the golden key chest craps out legendaries like there's no tomorrow. I have about 10 level variants of the new legendary combat rifle. Minimap was a nice idea. Makes the game easier to navigate, and lets you see when some bandit is trying to get the drop on you. Hud's more colorful. Menus are worse. Whoever the genius was who made it so you hit the bottom of the list and pop back to the top should be fired. Out of a cannon. You have to carefully and purposefully navigate the menus. If you're new to the series. sure, whatever. Pick it up. Fun with friends, kind of a slog alone. Old time player, not much has changed. Bugs remain unpatched. Some enemies literally remain unkillable. Claptrap still T-poses at everybody. Grind for some achievements is still absolutely ludicrous. Is it worth 32.99$ CAD? I guess. It includes the DLCs. I'd still wait for a sale, see if you can get it cheaper.

game_description: The Ultimate Vault Hunter’s Upgrade lets you get the most out of the Borderlands 2 experience.
review: I would love to say that I appreciate this game series, but honestly, due to the whole Epic Games Store exclusivity deal, I can't honestly say that I want any better for this company than for them to burn to the ground for their insolence. Sorry, Gearbox, but you of all people should know that the quality of a product isn't always the driving force behind its' appeal, but the appeal may lie solely in its' intentions, and it's obvious that your intentions are nothing good, that you care about money above all else, and don't care about making their fans happy, just their investors.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Finished my first play through. Some thoughts...

There seems to be a memory leak or something the games drops from 200 fps to 30 after a couple of hours of playtime requiring a restart to fix.

The aim was kinda wonky. I had to play it like CS:GO and drag my aim down. Might be auto aim though I have the option disabled.

I get stuck on terrain quite often like trying walk up stairs I just spaz out on the spot and don't move until I move back or jump.

The addition of the mini map is nice and the 4K graphics are appreciated but all in all I can't recommend the game in it's current state.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
Go fk yourself，2k



For those who say go to twitter to complain，it won't work. If twitter works，BL3 would not be on Epic the first place. If the reason for this shit is money，then only money loss can bring the message to them. I do not regret paying full price for this game at day one，and won't ask for refunding even if I could at this point，but if all it takes is a downvote and refuse to buy the game for them to realise the thing，so be it.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
Compared to previous Borderlands titles, this one was significantly less fun, mostly due to the ease of being knocked off the world and killed. there are so many more islands, cliffs and misleading way points to get to a location that i died at least 10x more times than Borderlands 2, cash was never an issue, and there was plenty of boxes to loot for ammo. but constantly having to back track because a random nade or pup knocked me off the map irritated me to no end, it's not a bad mechanic for open spaces, with walls and barricades that prevent you from falling off the world, but when you are on a island 90% of the time where you can be knocked off quite easily....
I purchased this game on sale and played through it once, it was as much as i could stand due to the poor game play.
The story is pretty good and on par with previous titles, and really the only saving grace this game had to hole me to play to the end. I didn't buy this game initially because it's mostly about handsome jack, and i really hated him in borderlands 2, but after playing all the way through pre-sequel i understand why he is so hated, and i still hate him and perhaps even more. but the love hate relationship of claptrap is now a little less hate, even though he is still quite annoying at times.
If you decide to get this game, it is for the story, not the game play, because i could only take small doses of being tossed off the map before i would quit the game in frustration.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
Compared to previous Borderlands titles, this one was significantly less fun, mostly due to the ease of being knocked off the world and killed. there are so many more islands, cliffs and misleading way points to get to a location that i died at least 10x more times than Borderlands 2, cash was never an issue, and there was plenty of boxes to loot for ammo. but constantly having to back track because a random nade or pup knocked me off the map irritated me to no end, it's not a bad mechanic for open spaces, with walls and barricades that prevent you from falling off the world, but when you are on a island 90% of the time where you can be knocked off quite easily....
I purchased this game on sale and played through it once, it was as much as i could stand due to the poor game play.
The story is pretty good and on par with previous titles, and really the only saving grace this game had to hole me to play to the end. I didn't buy this game initially because it's mostly about handsome jack, and i really hated him in borderlands 2, but after playing all the way through pre-sequel i understand why he is so hated, and i still hate him and perhaps even more. but the love hate relationship of claptrap is now a little less hate, even though he is still quite annoying at times.
If you decide to get this game, it is for the story, not the game play, because i could only take small doses of being tossed off the map before i would quit the game in frustration.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Not bad, adds a new spin to the game, but its riddled with many problems, the biggest of which are below.

1: There are points where the game just chugs in terms of framerate. It'll do just fine, 60FPS smooth as silk, then it shits the bed and struggles to make 30. This is at 1080p, and the same rig is capable of playing BL2 maxed out with minimal framedrops. Its definitely not a GPU bottleneck, the chugging part can get so bad my GPU drops into the low power low clocks idle state while a single CPU thread is maxed out.

2: Netcode needs an overhaul, as there's lag everywhere. Hit registration doesn't even work half the time; its a fine thing to be downed and unloading a Double Stinger SMG almost point blank into a Badass Psycho (not a small target by any means) and have half the shots simply phase through it even when said weapon is more than capable of bringing said enemy down. Sniping is a gamble, as even with a 97 acc weapon and the crosshairs dead center on the target's head while standing just outside of their aggro radius the shot has about a 50/50 chance of doing nothing other than alerting the whole area there's a vault hunter to kill.

3: Memory hog: the game uses a shitload of memory and the slow memory leak ensures it gets worse as time goes on. I've had sessions be forced to an end because BL:GOTYE was using 6 of my rig's 8GB (with the other 2 being juggled between the OS and other programs), and every couple of minutes or so its ever increasing pool of used memory would force another couple hundred MB of data out of ram onto the page file. Eventually the page-file fills up, and something crashes due to out of memory. This is absolutely unacceptable.

If you've got the game for free as I did from owning the original copy, its kinda worth a play through, but if you're looking to buy separately, dont.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review: Great game but many issues with this new version, first of all gameplay is cleaned up very fast paced and fun with 6 new legendary weapons, however to me the game feels very empty when playing the dlcs and the audio and cutscenes were not fixed at all. i can say the game is worth playing but not for the 30 dollar price tag, this honestly was a quick cash grab and its sad to say that the enhanced version hasnt changed much besides the quality if life and graphics which when running at max settings looks perfect. If you are able to download the update for free because of having borderlands goty previously i do urge you to do so, but for the 30 dollar price tag, look at g2a for cheap steam keys and do not spend the 30 dollars on a game that isnt fully remastered. I cant recommend unless you already own the original version.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
It's Borderlands, but now with added bugs and odd glitches that's never been there before. Bullets go through enemies, game crashes, doesn't like being alt-tabbed at all, co-op is laggy and gives random frame drops and the voice chat gave me cancer.
Can barely see the difference between this and the original version graphics wise so I don't think it's worth calling it an enhanced edition unless you count the added golden chest.
Might not be worth getting if you're feeling nostalgic. 

P.s. Not a review bomb, just an honest review.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Seeing this game remastered has been a blessing and a curse for me. The remaster experience has gone well, but I want to list a few gripes as to why I can't recommend this game right now in it's current state.

In this remaster you'll see many different things, but here's some stuff I noticed.

Positives:
-6 new legendary "gearbox" manufacturer weapons, which can be obtained from the golden chest or a very rare boss drop.
-New textures, new color for the experience bar, and the outlining for everything is smoother now.
-Favorite and trash system integrated from Borderlands 2 (which is a very nice addition)
-Lock on for vehicle weaponry.

Negatives:
-The performance would get *extremely* inconsistent and laggy, I'm referring to having 15-20 frames per second or less. It mostly only happens when I tab out or occasionally quit the game and load back in, but the frame loss stays after it starts. Now normally this wouldn't be an issue, however I'm using an RTX 2080, 32 GB of ram, and i7-9700k processor with current drivers and I've even closed all other tabs and programs running...but the problem persists. It wasn't a big enough issue for me to not play all the way through the game (like I did back when I played on xbox360), but I did not want to do a second playthrough or the dlc. If this gets patched, I'll amend my review.
-I noticed some loading screens aren't up to date. A minor issue, but it's things like that which get glossed over and you would expect would be in a remaster. (I.E. the rarity loading screen) It mentions rarity from white to orange, but excludes pearls.
-A lot of legacy exploits still exist, which makes me wonder if some of these bosses were meant to be fought this way. It's a minor thing really, mostly up to personal taste... but I feel like this could've been an opportunity to polish old bosses and make them worth fighting them over again. I don't want to fight them as if I'm still living in 2009 (which I didn't, I'm just using this example). Maybe it's too minor, but I thought I should mention it.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
This review is pretty much a copy/paste from my BL2 review...because sadly the SAME EXACT SH*T APPLIES TO THIS GAME...with that said, here ya go:

Runs like utter sh*te. Seriously. If you want to play at anything over 60fps, and have the hardware to do it in most games, don't even bother with this pile of trash. No matter the settings or tweaks, this WILL drop as low as 60fps on a system like mine; a 9900K, 2080Ti & 32GB of 3000Mhz DDR4 system mind you...even on all low at 1440p it runs like this. No rhyme or reason. It's unoptimized garbage. Real shame too, because the gameplay is decent and a lot of fun could be had if it was a smooth experience, especially with friends. 

Oh, one last thing...the devs and publishers are money grubbing scum that care more about making a extra buck than giving their community a good experience.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: The Ultimate Vault Hunter’s Upgrade lets you get the most out of the Borderlands 2 experience.
review:
As many others have pointed out, the use of the Epic Game Store for Borderlands 3 has assured I won't be buying BL3 on release or her on Steam when available. While I have no issue with other competitive services rivaling Steam, I am appalled by Epic Store's practice of no account security, poor feature availability such as an extensive review system/forums/etc., and their use of guaranteed sales quotas and exclusivity  contracts in lieu of creating an actually good service. This does not begin to mention data privacy concerns as well as their blatant disrespect of their customers, the consumers, with their statements made in board and shareholder meetings.

I encourage others that want to end this practice not only to not purchase this game on the Epic Store, but to avoid doing so on Steam following the end of exclusivity. Doing so only proves that the deal was good, as they "double dip" on the better value at Epic Store and appease those here at Steam. Vote with your wallet, folks.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review: Rewriting this review, because steam didn't allow me to post my previous one. I'll cut to the chase, I don't support the review bombing, so these are real issues I encountered. Got it? Cool. I've noticed my bullets fly through enemies, even at point blank range, I noticed FPS drops on singleplayer which should never happen because this can run on a toaster and my computer is not too shabby. I noticed animations bug out, with running animations either being sped up slowed down or generally just not occurring while I run. I got this for free because I had bought the game before, shame the game is a buggy unplayable mess for me, because I loved it on my ps3 and the original on steam. Make your own judgement though, my bad experience isn't going to necessarily be yours, the game itself is fantastic and I do think if you've never played it you should, but maybe buy the original instead to be safe.

game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review: Borderlands is one of my favourite game series of all time, and I was stoked to find out that they were remastering the first game but seriously this remaster is dog shit. Yes, it's added a few QOL things which is great, but the game is now 100% unplayable if you try to play coop. It is a stuttery, laggy mess. Seriously if I didn't love this game I wouldnt bother. To be honest I'm having to talk myself into playing this game due to all this crap. And I shouldn't have to do that, I love Borderlands but how have they fucked up so badly?

review:
Can't recommend in its current state. Would have rather seen a 1-2 month delay in launching over these terrible multiplayer connection issues. You're lucky if its 15 minutes between player dc's.

-Suffers from frame instability
-loot bugged (drops level 5-10 stuff at almost 30)
-Multiplayer connection issues


FIX FOR MULTIPLAYER:
Co-op Lag Fix Borderlands GOTY Enhanced
Navigate to Documents\My Games\Borderlands Game of the Year\WillowGame\Config

Open up the WillowEngine.ini
Find bHasVoiceEnabled=True and change it to bHasVoiceEnabled=False
Save and close the file. Go to the properties and mark as read-only.
To run the game, locate the .exe in the root folder from Config and run the game straight from the .exe.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: The Ultimate Vault Hunter’s Upgrade lets you get the most out of the Borderlands 2 experience.
review:
I like 2k games such as the darkness 2 and the bioshock series. In this you die way too easily. your ammo depletes too quickly and when you kill most enemies at least in the snow level as i got near the elevator before i had enough of how bad this game is. You almost never get ammo from dead enemies. Why is there even an ammo store and a gun store? What can they not sell the same thing? I know there's an RPG element to it so I should not be a terminator right away but even if you're say level 5 and you fight a level 5 enemy it's not as balanced as it should be compared to other 2K first person shooters such as bioshock 2 where if you're in say the amusement park all the enemies are so strong and then you go to the next level and they are just a bit stronger but still challenging, there is usually not enough time to jump sideways or so to dodge those big snow balls so you've got to just keep taking hits and it's sickening how fast your health can deplete. I should not have to die every 5 minutes to level up to beat this game where i have to be level say 6 to beat a level 5 enemy.

The robot is extremely annoying and i laughed once, trevor in gta 5 for example is funny because he doesn't try. This is like a 3rd grader trying to be funny beside you during an entire adventure. 

what I didn't like is you've got to meet the person to collect rewards like some stupid bounty hunter instead of just glowing letters "mission complete" or some crap where the XP is wired to your profile but no say I go to that british guy do a task or two i got to go see him again.. come on. They give you this stupid warping to other worlds thing way too quickly and instead of locking the high leveled ones away which is common sense you just walk in with no warning and woosh dead for the 99th time. With my luck the first place i went to as it was closest and it made the most sense everyone was level 30/31. I really was excited and tried to play this with a clear head but this game is trash. Luckily I got a refund.

review:
Reasons not to use Epic Store:
1) They have terrible security, 80 million accounts were exposed last week
2) They have terrible customer service
3) Games are more expensive on the Epic store due to regional pricing
4) You can't play games offline
5) Limited social features
6) No screenshot support
7) No controller support
8) They broke EU laws 
9) You have to tick a box to opt out of emails
10) They are partially owned by Tencent, a company that sells user data to the Chinese government
11) No achievements
12) No cloud saves
13) No game forums
14) They make you pay the transaction fee when purchasing games separate from tax
15) They pay for exclusive rights to games to try and force you to use their store
16) They can refuse refunds even if you meet the criteria
17) No reviews
18) No Linux support

All this alone should let everyone know about the current situation with Borderlands and Take-Two Interactive.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
This game is great, when you're playing by yourself. However, I have a group of friends trying to play this game online, and we can't play it legitimately because the online is completely broken. The game lags like crazy, especially in The Dahl Headlands. 
The positives to this game are:
- The graphics
- The smoothness
- Some added features
The Cons however are:
- Online is mostly unplayable
- Frame rate issues in a lot of areas
- Lag beyond control

It's a great upgrade, especially for free. However, I feel as though it should not have been released until everything was properly checked. Will change my review when all these issues are corrected.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Prefacing by saying that I am not here to review bomb, and I've played around 20 hours when my internet was out. I'll probably play a little more to see if it ever smooths out, but so far my experience has not been a pleasant one compared to just modding the original.

The good :

-Slight improvement to graphics
-Money and ammo now auto picks up
-Can now lock guns so  that a window pops up when you try to sell as well as mark others as junk so you can quickly sell what you don't want
-Updated GUI
-decent performance fps wise

The bad : 

Putting this game in the new engine causes a lot of issues with the terrain that range from annoying to practically unplayable at parts because you can get stuck in walls and the floor. Example : you go to duck out of a fight only to find you can't duck because you're caught in/on the wall/floor/bush/dead enemy. another example of this is when you go to duck on cover and the enemies get stuck in an animation loop on a piece of scenery. It makes a fight that otherwise is intense turn into just stopping to laugh at the skag stuck in the scenery. 

Another example of the new engine ruining things: 
Driving along in the car with the boost on, there's a tiny pebble in the road. your whole car completely stops as if you just hit a brick wall. Fine, we'll avoid that spot by jumping this cliff after backing up. Oh look, the edge of a cliff also had an invisible wall and stole all your speed for the jump and now you died when you could have just ramped to the other cliff and been fine in the normal game.

This is an "I've heard" but haven't done for myself because I USUALLY do borderlands single player, but apparently the multiplayer is bugged all to hell with lag and desyncs galore.


TL;DR, Conclusion:

Just mod the original to look roughly the same or better than the enhanced version, without all the annoying scenery/engine glitches and deal with it taking just a few seconds longer to sell and pick up items.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review: The graphic haven't changed much but the system requirements sure have!!! I have an i5-8400T CPU, 8Gb RAM, SSD harddisk and a GeForce GTX 1050 but it's not enough!?! How can you remaster a game where you almost can't tell the difference in the graphics compared with the original but still make the requirements that much higher? I know it's "free" (at least for me) but c'mon. It's smells more like a "buy the new GTX 2070 so you can play this free game" or it's just REALLY bad coding.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Unlike my recent spite filled review of Borderlands 2 on account of the Epic Games store conundrum, I do have an actual complaint. As of right now (April 5th, 2019) there are audio files that bear heavy compression artifacts, and that is something that would normally make me return the game on account of a massive headache (I was given a copy for free via the Handsome Collection). That being said, the game has been fun, and while the movement and gunplay seem a bit clunky, it still offers a fun experience. I only wish they would spruce up the audio in pre-rendered cutscenes, as that's where it appears to be at it's worst.

Fix that one little bit Gearbox, and I might flip the negative to a positive.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Get ready for the mind blowing insanity! Play as one of four trigger-happy mercenaries and take out everything that stands in your way! With its addictive action, frantic first-person shooter combat, massive arsenal of weaponry, RPG elements and four-player co-op, Borderlands is a breakthrough experience that challenges all the...
review:
Epic Store is trash. Exclusivity deals on PC gaming is trash. Don't support Epic or the companies that sign exclusivity deals.

Steam ain't perfect, but exclusivity isn't competition. If Epic wanted to compete, they'd build a better platform. They're not trying to win people over, they're trying to strongarm people into using their platform. They don't care about the consumer, they said developers will decide who wins this battle. Tim Sweeney is a hypocrite for complaining about Windows Game Store dividing the PC userbase, then doing it himself. Epic is not good for gaming, it's divisive and anti-consumer.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
Doesn't stack up to the first two.  I played it with some friends and it wasn't torturous..  But if you haven't played any borderlands and are thinking the newest is probably the best.  It is not.  If you have played the other games and are wanting more... you won't quite get it.

It is sadly just a forgettable game.  I don't even remember what character I played as.  Whereas I remember exactly what characters I played through 1 & 2 with, and what builds I went with, and what cool loot I got that fit my characters.

Lastly playing for the lore aspect of it has some value, but given the recent decisions and interactions of the the team, I don't have any faith that getting invested in the universe is going to pay off for you in the future.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
Doesn't stack up to the first two.  I played it with some friends and it wasn't torturous..  But if you haven't played any borderlands and are thinking the newest is probably the best.  It is not.  If you have played the other games and are wanting more... you won't quite get it.

It is sadly just a forgettable game.  I don't even remember what character I played as.  Whereas I remember exactly what characters I played through 1 & 2 with, and what builds I went with, and what cool loot I got that fit my characters.

Lastly playing for the lore aspect of it has some value, but given the recent decisions and interactions of the the team, I don't have any faith that getting invested in the universe is going to pay off for you in the future.

With its addictive action, frantic first-person shooter combat, massive arsenal of weaponry, RPG elements and four-player co-op, Borderlands is a breakthrough experience that challenges all the...
review:
Borderlands is for me the most overrated game series in recent history. These games are just mediocore shooters. This game has tons of problems and even more in newer remastered edition. There is no story, unbalanced combat, and even no humor, which is main reason why a lot of people love Borderlands. I bought all three games in huge expectations, because from videos it looks like a ton of fun and i loved it already. I read many times that it is a lot better playing solo to enjoy the characters, story etc, which was another reason why I jumped in this series. But all of the games are so messy, boring, funny jokes are only in trailers, stupid enemies, stupid game mechanics and I can talk about other reasons why I was totally surprised how bad these games are.
5/10 only because I have some hope that it is a little fun in more players and for some small originality

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
to all those people ♥♥♥♥♥ing about the review bombing...

2k has shown that it clearly does NOT care about the consumers by making borderlands 3 exclusive to the epic games launcher for a limited time, despite the epic games store being universally hated by the pc gaming community. why? because they were paid to do so. this is a huge middle finger to the steam community, and may even harm the pc gaming industry in the long run. epic pays devs/publishers huge sums of money to get their games to be exclusive to their ♥♥♥♥♥♥ platform for a limited time, which means that even if the game fails, they still profit from the sheer amount of money epic paid them before they even launched the game. because of this, they could easily say "what's the point of making a high quality product if we profit off of it anyway?" thus leaving us with a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game even AFTER we wait for it to come to steam.

the pc gaming community is not a group of people that let themselves get pushed around like ragdolls. no, if you push us around, we will push BACK in any way we can, and epic, as well as anyone partnering with them for timed exclusives, are going to learn this the hard way.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
After spending tons and tons of time and making many friends in this game I'm going to have to say that you shouldn't buy it. 
Reason being is that the company producing the next game in the saga decided that an exclusivity deal with a company that is frankly terrible with terrible business practices will have their next game on their launcher *cough cough* Epic. They're basically spitting in the face of long time players of their game. There's nothing that Epic offers that steam doesn't in fact they offer less. Gearbox doesn't deserve your time or money. There are plenty more shooter type games from other indie developers that would be worth your money. They've gone down the route of greed. One of the developers of the original borderlands on twitter is acting like a total asshole too. So that's pretty much how he's going to treat your feedback of the game.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
After spending tons and tons of time and making many friends in this game I'm going to have to say that you shouldn't buy it. 
Reason being is that the company producing the next game in the saga decided that an exclusivity deal with a company that is frankly terrible with terrible business practices will have their next game on their launcher *cough cough* Epic. They're basically spitting in the face of long time players of their game. There's nothing that Epic offers that steam doesn't in fact they offer less. Gearbox doesn't deserve your time or money. There are plenty more shooter type games from other indie developers that would be worth your money. They've gone down the route of greed. One of the developers of the original borderlands on twitter is acting like a total asshole too. So that's pretty much how he's going to treat your feedback of the game.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Gearbox isn't just making bad business decisions nowadays. But also bad work.
This is the piss poorest port of all time.
As someone said here....this game should be called Borderlands:  The Slideshow edition.
This is the best example of: "just because it is free, doesn't meant in's good"
New bugs all over the place, game crashes, over and over again. After playing an hour, virtual memory overflooding and game needs to be restarted, minimap bugs and objective markers bugged. The list is endless.

Played the game   with friends back when it came out till our eyes begun to bleed. Playing this with the same friends, and it's more of a pain in the a** than enjoyment.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Get ready for the mind blowing insanity! Play as one of four trigger-happy mercenaries and take out everything that stands in your way! With its addictive action, frantic first-person shooter combat, massive arsenal of weaponry, RPG elements and four-player co-op, Borderlands is a breakthrough experience that challenges all the...
review:
I've thoroughly enjoyed the Borderlands series so far, but the "Enhanced" edition is a buggy mess! Audio issues, framerate issues, non-existent enemies popping in and out, and worst of all shooting AND aiming will stop working OCCASIONALLY. I've never experienced any of these issues with the original edition. 

Gearbox please fix your game!

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
A real disappointment after the second game, which in my opinion wasn't as good as the first one. I had to really struggle to finish it the first time. I impulse bought all the DLC and haven't played any of them yet. I'll probably finish them eventually, but I am a super fan. If you are a super fan you probably had this game already. If you are wondering what this whole borderlands thing is about, the second one is probably the most approachable, while the first one is the best imo.

Its a shame too, because the class design was much more interesting and diverse than other games, but the level design, writing, quest design and plot points are a chore to get through, Most of my playtime has been getting each class up enough to try out some interesting builds. It wasn't worth the effort.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

Its a shame too, because the class design was much more interesting and diverse than other games, but the level design, writing, quest design and plot points are a chore to get through, Most of my playtime has been getting each class up enough to try out some interesting builds. It wasn't worth the effort.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: The Ultimate Vault Hunter’s Upgrade lets you get the most out of the Borderlands 2 experience.
review:
Just thought I would do my first review bomb in response to Steams decision to silence its own customers through 'curation' of the reviews.
Ironically Steam is shutting down reviews for a game thats sequel is coming exclusively to another platform, so now people are review bombing this game (its predecessor) in protest, which Steam in turn is censoring to please the same publisher that isnt releasing thier new game here. You cant make this stuff up!

I myself am review bombing this game as both a test to Steams new system and in general protest to Steams new system. 

As far as what others are review bombing this game for, I completely disagree with them. I dont use Epic Games, but maybe if Steam wasnt so greedy with thier publishers they wouldnt be in this mess! Everyone complaining are a bunch of commies, its Steam you should be pissed at!  

BTW, I love Borderlands II, its stupid fun with friends. Its simply got caught in the crossfire between fans, Steam and 2K.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review: I find it hard to run 144 FPS consistently without a lot of big dips into the 50-60 FPS range both on 4K and 1440p. I'm running the game with an RTX 2080 Aorus Waterforce Xtreme @2025Mhz, 16GB Corsair DDR4 RAM Quad-Channel @3000Mhz, Samsung 860 Pro and an i7-5390k @ 4.4Ghz. Please optimize the game better!!

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
This game is pretty much Borderlands 2 but with a way worse story, the writing's not bad, there are actually some portions that I thought were amazingly well written. I personally couldn't finish the game because I kept getting bored, I was close to the end, but that part is just REALLY boring. The game is the worst of the 3 in most ways, the character balancing is good, so there aren't any characters like Gaige, which is a downside in my eyes.

Overall: THE GAME IS TOO BORING.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: The Ultimate Vault Hunter’s Upgrade lets you get the most out of the Borderlands 2 experience.
review:
This is an test-review to see if Steam is really that biased they would delete over 4000 reviews just because people complain about a publisher that is screwing around with gamers!

I never cared for Borderlands and I barely played it.
Reason: The story is meh, the graphics are meh and the game design is also very meh.
Dont know what people liked on this game more than on any Metro game!
Not recommened because of obvious reason!

Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Okay I've heard of all the bugs and I was gonna look past them anyways when I started playing, make a positive review since this was given to me for free.
However, I CAN'T EVEN PLAY THE GAME.
I click play, it says it's running then nothing, it just stops.
That is completely unacceptable, I had to actively go into the files and skip the launcher in order to play this game.

Additional (I'm going to add things as I play more:
The hats absolutely suck might as well not list it as a feature.
They haven't changed the sprint, if you sprint to the left while moving your camera to the right you cancel the sprint, if you move the camera too much while sprinting you cancel the sprint.
The graphics have improved.
Having the minimap is great.
When you buy ammo upgrades there's dialogue to confirm or cancel which fades away, it shouldn't be there.
Going through the menus (On mouse and keyboard) is a calamity.
Click melee button too fast on certain melee bonus weapons and melee rate is slowed.
Melee with the weapon as soon as you pull it out and it will do the cocking animation over and over.
Online is a shitshow full of glitches.
Random custom waypoints showing up for no reason.

I just want to comment on the release of this game a little. There was a lot of things wrong with the original that were improved upon the next games. We look past the flaws on the OG because it was something new and it was a product of it's time. This is officially a 2019 game, people should expect higher quality to match the time. It's been 10 years, it's unacceptable to release the same game with very little improvements to the base game. When I opened this game I was expecting Borderlands ENHANCED not PLUS, they added more shit than they improved. And you know what I didn't buy it so I'm fine but for people who don't I do not think it's worth 30$

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: The Ultimate Vault Hunter’s Upgrade lets you get the most out of the Borderlands 2 experience.
review:
I will remove this review when BL3 comes out on Steam.

Reasons not to use Epic Store: 
1) They have terrible security (80 million accounts were exposed last week)
2) They have terrible customer service (just google it) 
3) Games are more expensive on Epic due to regional pricing 
4) You can't play games offline 
5) Limited social features 
6) No screenshots 
7) No controller support 
8) They broke EU laws (and still do) 
9) Scummy tactics (you had to tick a box to opt out of emails etc) 
10) They are partially owned by Tencent (a company that sells user data to the Chinese government)
11) No achievements 
12) No cloud saves 
13) No game forums (many people went to steam for subnautica support) 
14) Epic make you pay the transaction fee when purchasing games 
15)They are anti-consumer (They pay for exclusive rights to games to try and force you to use their store)
16) They can refuse refunds even if you meet the criteria 
17) No reviews 
18) No Linux support

I love you Gearbox, you haven't failed us in the past, and we get that its 2k. But stand up to them. Make it clear that you won't let an executive decision ruin a perfectly good game.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
RE-mastered to have the same issues of old, so after all the time and experience I am amazed I have to yet again to have to go wading through .ini files to fix the same crap that was occuring 10 years ago,.

If your going to try and placate the mob with freebies because you made unpopular marketing choices at least make the freebie work better than the old version, kinda the point of a remastered, not slapping some make up and spraying perfume onto a corpse.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review: I may be alone with this, but I just didn't find this game nearly as fun as the first borderlands, the gameplay gets repetitive and there are a lot of quests that require long travel just to deliver various quest items to other characters (at least in the early game). Personally I found the repetitive nature of the early part of the game made it so exceedingly boring that I quit it after about 8 hours of gameplay. I also felt that the item drops were just more of the same after a point leading to not really many actual choices for different weapons and load outs. I feel like the game developers tried to capitalize upon their prior successes without actually making anything new. This game is basically the Call of Duty of looter shooters at this point.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
Honestly? 
Not really that good anymore.

So many awful design decisions
lots of backtracking
There are like... 4 enemy types
quest design is really boring ... aaaand..
... You can only see 1 questmarker at once (What the fuck is this shit, this is EXTREMELY frustrating)
Loot isn't really all that interesting
All areas basically look the same

For a 2019 "enhanced" version this is missing A LOT of quality of life improvements.
I guess it was alright back in the day, but I'd really not recommend it anymore

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
you probably already know this, but if you don't here is the gist of why this game is dogshit.

-god damnit you spend like 70% of your time outside of an oxygen rich environment, having to constantly monitor your O2 levels. that's just not fun, I promise you.

-the fuck happened to laser guns in bl1-2? where'd it go? where's the cryo element, wheres s&s, atlas etc. 

-side quests are both incredibly tedious *and* effectively mandatory due to the main story being both short and not exp rich enough to keep you at level for it, so i sure hope you like claptrap, because everyones fuckin claptrap.

tl;dr it does little more than take a big ol dump on the game and it's story and mechanically it's been oxygen deprived. 

do not buy, even for free.

I really hope the developers don't have the sheer balls to treat the negative reception of this poor excuse of a rerelease in the current backlash of their shenanigans .

review: 2k is a TRASH COMPANY DO NOT BUY THIS OR ANY BORDERLANDS GAME EVER. Epic Games is taking companies with it from steam one by one. Also Enjoy $250 lootboxesin Borderlands 3 LOL! And the paid XP boosts microtransactions and many more! This game series have sold their soul to the devil.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
Quite honestly, this is the WORST "Triple A" FPS game I've ever played in my life.

The zero gravity gets old in 5 minutes, and I'm supposed to play an entire game like this?

Enemies fly around freely and shoot me from angles and spots I can't see quite often. As long as they have a couple pixels exposed, they can shoot at you. Nothing but Scavs hiding behind jagged rocks, which seem to respawn endlessly during boss fights.

I can't believe design decisions like this were made, but then I realized it was probably made by a bunch of Australian SJWs. Then the lack of good decision making starts to become clear.

I DEEPLY regret wasting the $10 I did on buying it, because I've now basically condoned this terrible game making, which shames me, and I've now lost 2 hours that I will NEVER get back again.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review: Personally I like to play games at 600 EDPI, or 4.5 degrees for every centimetre I move my mouse, but that isn't possible in any of the Borderlands games because of the distinct lack of sensitivity options. Like seriously, the lowest amount is almost ten times as much as I want it to be! The game is such a masterpiece but it is completely ruined by the lack of comfort I am forced to have by these horrible settings. Some love letter to PC gamers this was supposed to be, I wouldn't recommend playing this game at all if you have even a moderately low sensitivity. I originally played this franchise on my PS3 and my PS4, and I was having so much fun there, finishing at least one character of TVHM with DLC for each game, and it was amazing, but the ridiculously, unreasonably high sensitivity I am forced to endure on PC is just not worth it whatsoever. I recieved this product for free for owning the original Borderlands game that I bought a week prior.
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
Doing my part to fight back against the evil Epic Games store and their anti-consumer business practices. 

Epic clearly has no intentions of competing with Steam. their goal is to eliminate it by starving it of it's products entirely. They think they can get away with this too. They think that the customers have no say in the matter. but we do have a say. Don't buy this game, or any other game made by any studio who allows themselves to be bought out by Epic Games. Show the publishers of this shitty industry that timed exclusivity deals WILL hurt their sales. if you wanna play it, pirate it until they stop this shit.

as for an actual review of this game, it's decent, but I would recommend Borderlands 2 if you're new to the series.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
I was pretty excited to see this game in my library as I was just thinking about playing though the whole series again with my girlfriend. I tweaked the settings and booted up the game, got through the enormous EULA and started the game up and...it stutters. Horribly. I suffer through the introduction, skipping what I can and get into the settings and tweak it again. I manage to get rid of the stutter but it's still jerky with random framerate drops. 
There's no reason why a 10 year old game should run this poorly on a year old machine. Even with HD upgrades. I have no issues running any other HD game I try, but for some reason this one runs like garbage. I really appreciate the freebie, but I think it would have been better to just have kept it to yourself until it was done. I sure hope this isn't a sign of things to come.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
Writing is even more garbage than anything in BL2, ALL the characters that talk to you are unbearable except for Jack, the pacing is terrible, maps are mostly big empty moonspace areas,  (traversing them without moonscaping is a total chore, the vehicles drive like buttered anvils) there's barely anything new and absolutely no end game content. 
The only positives are the movement system that's kinda fun but totally underdevelopped, and the characters you can play as. Too bad they're in a garbage game so there's no real reason to experience them.

review:
The visual upgrades are impressive, though it is unacceptable that even my old PC only gets about 5FPS out of this game.
For reference, I play the division at 45 FPS and apex legends at 60 capped.
This should not be an issue, and either it should be fixed, or more issues should be provided in the graphics department so I can play this with my friends AND hit a skag every once in a while.

review: This is something I really won't ever do, but I'm leaving a negative review for this game on account of the publisher's recent decision regarding the Epic Games Store, exclusivity, and blatant disregard for the PC audience. I am an owner of a PS4 as well as a Gaming PC, but that still won't make me buy the game on account of the E.G.S. decision alone. Borderlands 2 is a great game, with great mechanics, story, and replayability, but I abhor Tim Sweeney and 2k's decision to put the game exclusively his "Launcher". Would you like some spyware with your exclusive games? No thank you.

review:
This game is a hard sell after all of these years. Although I appreciate the free upgrade, replaying it has made me realize that Borderlands 1 has not aged very well at all. A lot of the new features added into the Enhanced edition can't fix the core problems of boring mass fetch quests that make you repeat the same areas over and over again.

I am also in open boycott of the Borderlands 3 Epic Exclusive.

review:
I wasn't apart of the review bomb stuff, I dislike all of epic games's crap as much as the next guy. But steam should have no right to remove review, this is just like rotten tomatoes, this is unacceptable. Steam is a platform for reviewing and sharing opinions, the fact that gearbox made a game that has been on steam for years exclusive is insane. People have a right to share their opinions on the topic. Theyve all paid for borderlands and played them over the years. There would not be a borderlands 3 if it wasn't for these people. That more then affords them this right. 

For steam to remove peoples voice... is absolutely deplorable. America was founded on the freedom to speak and to be heard. I am ashamed to have spend so much time and money on this platform now.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
If you like Borderlands you will like this game's gameplay, though the low grav can get tedious. That being said, the story is forgettable and the ham fisted sjw characters are so poorly written. If you're going to go out of your way to throw your personal politics into the game, at least don't just lecture and berate the players.

Right off the bat, within the tutorial, some poorly voiced, forgettable Aussie lesbo character says white men are homophobes and the first few quests are you killing "enemies" who said mean words to her. Not even joking, all they did was offend her. Even in imaginary fantasy worlds depicted in video games, progressives are fragile, pathetic excuses for human beings who are willing to hurt people because they said things.

UPDATE AFTER 10 HRS PLAYED

I couldn't even continue playing for the story. It was terrible. I wanted to play because I wanted to learn Jack's backstory and I loved BL and BL2. This game is trash. The zero gravity gets very boring, every character is very poorly voice acted, and the maps are very very very bland and uninteresting. Also, the writers were not as clever as they thought they were. They seemed very pleased with themselves with the names of enemies especially, but saying Kragon 45 miliion times won't make me appreciate it any more. If you love gay and gender politics being inserted into the game every chance they get, this game is for you. If you like Borderlands 2 this game may be playable for the story of Jack only. Otherwise, this game is utter garbage.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Launch into the Borderlands universe and shoot ‘n’ loot your way through a brand new adventure that rockets you onto Pandora’s moon in Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel!
review:
It's a tough call between recommending this game or not. If this were a separate game on it's own, most people would probably have recommended it more readily. Inevitably, because this is another BL series, comparisons tend to be drawn against BL2 which is a far better and more complete game. 

If on sale, go for it though.

Pros: 
- Many different characters to try with good ability trees
- Add on to the story line
- More handsome jack

Cons:
- Lazy side quest designs, most of them are annoying fetch quests that adds no value
- Most annoying BL character - Pickle. If I could blow him up, I would.
- Unclear map objectives, mini maps, lack of fast travels to many locations
- Space jumping is not my cup of tea
- Inventory, shared stash and bank space.
- Less interesting and humorous conversations compared to BL2

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
If you have never played Borderlands, you can buy it, it's a good game.
But for an "enhanced" version, it's clear Gearbox did not test it. [spoiler]Like Duke Nukem World Tour[/spoiler] 

- Audio logs sometime suddenly stop.
- Reload animation on some SMG is broken.
- Menu to sell items on some shop does not show the weapon you want to sell, you have to use the arrow keys to make it works.
- Could have update the class mod system to be visible in the skill trees.
- Minimap randomly zoom in, and I have to press Esc to set the reset the zoom
- When I open the quest log and click on a quest, it places a map marker (not an objective marker)
- SpLiTsCrEeN iS tOo HaRd To PoRt FrOm CoNsOlE.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Play as one of 4 new vault hunters facing off against a new world of creatures, psychos and the evil mastermind, Handsome Jack. Make new friends, arm them with a gazillion weapons and fight alongside them in four-player co-op or split-screen on a relentless quest for revenge and redemption across the undiscovered and unpredictable living planet.
review: Way over-hyped game. It has a unique graphic setting thats kinda cool, ok. The story is mediocre but not really entertaining. No real twists or something original. Its also a big grindfest and reminds more of vanilla world of warcraft than being a cool action-game. Played it for a couple of hours and then lost interest. Every Red Faction title is way more entertaining than this one! So yeah you can skip it and get a good game instead!
